name: The Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
bio: J-PAL aims to reduce global poverty by ensuring that policy is informed by scientific evidence. It focuses on research, policy outreach, and training.

name: Blueprint Labs
bio: Blueprint Labs utilizes economics and data to analyze the impact of policy decisions, focusing on education, healthcare, and the workforce.

name: Centre for Economic Performance (CEP)
bio: CEP at the London School of Economics specializes in researching the determinants of economic performance at the company, national, and global levels.

name: Berkeley Economic Analysis & Policy Group
bio: This group at UC Berkeley focuses on empirical and theoretical analysis in various economic policy areas.

name: Stanford Institute for Economic Policy Research (SIEPR)
bio: SIEPR aims to influence economic policy through research and scholarly debate on major economic policy issues.

name: Harvard Economic Research
bio: Harvard's economic research covers a broad spectrum of topics, with a focus on developing a deep understanding of economic phenomena.

name: Oxford Economics Department
bio: Oxford's Economics Department is dedicated to excellence in research and education, with a strong focus on economic theory and its application.

name: MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL)
bio: CSAIL at MIT is focused on innovative research in computer science, particularly in AI, systems, theory, and robotics.

name: Stanford Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (SAIL)
bio: SAIL is dedicated to the study and development of AI and its applications, aiming to improve human life through advancements in AI.

name: UC Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research Lab (BAIR)
bio: BAIR conducts cutting-edge research in AI, machine learning, robotics, and related fields, contributing significantly to the advancement of these technologies.

name: Carnegie Mellon Robotics Institute
bio: This institute at Carnegie Mellon University is a leading center for robotics research, working on innovative solutions in automation, robotics, and AI.

name: Oxford Robotics Institute
bio: The Oxford Robotics Institute focuses on machine learning and robotics, aiming to develop new technologies for autonomous systems.

name: Max Planck Institute for Informatics
bio: This German institute is renowned for its research in informatics, including algorithms, computational biology, and computer graphics.

name: ETH Zurich Institute for Machine Learning
bio: ETH Zurich's Machine Learning Institute focuses on the development and understanding of machine learning and AI algorithms, with applications across various domains.

name: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
bio: The Broad Institute is a collaboration between MIT and Harvard, focusing on the use of genomics to improve human health.

name: Whitehead Institute for Biomedical Research
bio: Affiliated with MIT, the Whitehead Institute conducts research in genetics, cancer, stem cells, and infectious diseases.

name: The Sainsbury Laboratory, University of Cambridge
bio: This laboratory specializes in plant development and computational modeling to understand plant growth and development.

name: European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL)
bio: EMBL is an intergovernmental organization focused on research in molecular biology, with various locations across Europe.

name: Max Planck Institute for Developmental Biology
bio: This institute in Germany focuses on the molecular mechanisms of organism development and evolution.

name: The Rockefeller University
bio: Rockefeller University is a leading research institution in the US, known for its work in molecular biology, genetics, and neuroscience.

name: Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory
bio: CSHL is a private research institution specializing in cancer, neuroscience, plant biology, genomics, and quantitative biology.

name: Francis Crick Institute
bio: Located in London, the Crick Institute conducts research in biology to understand why disease develops and to find new ways to treat, diagnose and prevent illnesses.

name: Weizmann Institute of Science
bio: This institute in Israel is known for its multidisciplinary research in biology and other natural sciences.

name: Salk Institute for Biological Studies
bio: The Salk Institute in California focuses on research in cancer, neuroscience, aging, and plant biology.

name: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
bio: Located at the University of Oxford, this institute aims to explore the future of journalism worldwide through debate, research, and leadership development.

name: Tow Center for Digital Journalism
bio: Based at Columbia University, the Tow Center explores how the digital era is affecting journalism and its relationship with audiences, through research and experimentation.

name: MIT Media Lab Journalism Group
bio: This group at MIT Media Lab focuses on the intersection of technology and journalism, experimenting with new methods of news production and distribution.

name: Berkeley Center for New Media
bio: The Berkeley Center for New Media at UC Berkeley integrates technology, art, and culture, focusing on research and critical theory in new media, including journalism.

name: Stanford Computational Journalism Lab
bio: This lab at Stanford University focuses on leveraging computational methods to evolve the practices of investigative journalism and storytelling.
